abstract.p: Two security guards aboard mountain bikes begin patrolling grounds of Westchester Medical Center in Valhalla, NY; photo (By the Way column) (S)

block.p: Visitors to the Westchester Medical Center in Valhalla might be surprised to see security guards pedaling around the grounds on mountain bikes. Two bike officers began patrolling at the end of April.

''We dont have crime here,'' said Norman Werner, the former security coordinator who came up with the idea for bike patrols. So the main job of the hospital's 85 security guards is dealing with emergencies on the 92-acre campus. The bicycles allow guards to reach spots that the centers Jeeps cannot and to get there faster than guards on foot.

Daren D. Turman, one of the bike officers, said that in one instance a man had had a seizure behind some parked cars and his companion flagged Mr. Turman down. ''If I hadn't been riding the bike, the person would have had a hard time getting help,'' he said.
Another benefit: ''I've lost an inch and a half on my waistline.''
